page.syntax: Filter_Expression as C = top_percent_records(percent as n[,filter as c])

argument.name: Filter_Expression
argument.description: An expression that selects records from a table.

argument.name: percent
argument.description: A positive number less than or equal to 100. Numeric

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table. Character

page.description: Return the top N percent of records for a given sort order.
page.discussion: A special function used only in queries to return the top Percent of records in a table for a given sort order. If the optional filter is supplied, only the records selected by the filter are returned. Note : The term "top" does not imply that record values are examined. "Top" means first, given the current sort order.

section.description: See Top, Bottom, Nth Record and Random Record Queries for more information. The following query, which could be attached to a button on a form, returns the top 10% of students in a school.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.current() query.filter = "top_percent_records(10)" query.order = "grade_point_average" inx = tbl.query_create() topparent.resynch()
